medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was transferred to the ED after a fall, presenting febrile with an elevated WBC count. She did not recall the fall or having abdominal or chest pain. She reported dysuria, with pain in the bladder area, and her son noted wheezing over the past 2 weeks, particularly with exertion. She fell at 3 AM after leaving the bathroom, and at baseline, has short/long term memory problems. There was a recent episode of garbled speech weeks prior that resolved by the next morning.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension, coronary artery disease (s/p 3-vessel CABG), Behcet's disease (on methotrexate), and recurrent UTIs (Klebsiella and Pseudomonas sensitive to ciprofloxacin).
medical_history.family_history: No family history of early MI, arrhythmia, cardiomyopathies, or sudden cardiac death; otherwise non-contributory.
